meanings.definition: A cemetery, especially a large and ancient one.
meanings.sent1: The ancient necropoles held the remains of many generations.
meanings.sent2: Visiting the necropoles on Halloween felt eerie and solemn.
meanings.sent3: The necropoles were so full, even the ghosts had to wait in line.
meanings.sent4: The necropoles whispered stories of the past to those who listened.
meanings.sent5: The necropoles stretched far and wide, a silent city of memories.

meanings.definition: A city of the dead; a burial ground.
meanings.sent1: The necropoles were peaceful, with rows of gravestones under the moonlight.
meanings.sent2: The necropoles were a somber reminder of life's fleeting nature.
meanings.sent3: The necropoles seemed to have their own ghostly mayor, overseeing the quiet city.
meanings.sent4: The necropoles stood as a testament to the passage of time, each tombstone a chapter in history.
meanings.sent5: The necropoles were a maze of memories, where the past whispered in the wind.
